Package application

Class Company

java.lang.Object
application.Company
public class Company
extends java.lang.Object
The company class is responsible for all the changes that happens within the employee list. It contains helper methods as well as methods used to be called when a user inputs a command.
Author:
Ceceliachollette-Dickson, Nidaansari

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int CAPACITY  
    private Employee[] emplist  
    private int numEmployee  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Company()
    The default constructor to make empty employee system.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean add​(Employee employee)
    This method adds employees to our employee array.
    java.lang.String exportDatabase​(java.io.File sourceFile)
    Helps export the current database.
    private int find​(Employee employee)
    A helper method used within the public methods in this class to find the index of a requested employee.
    private void grow()
    A helper method we use in the add() method to grow the array everytime it reaches maximum capacity.
    java.lang.String print()
    This method is invoked to print the current state of the employee list.
    java.lang.String printByDate()
    This method is invoked to print the employee list by the dates each employee was hired in ascending order.
    java.lang.String printByDepartment()
    This method is invoked to print the employee list by department in alphabetical order.
    void processPayments()
    This method is to be called in the PayrollProcessing class when a user commands the program to give the employees their bi-weekly payments.
    boolean remove​(Employee employee)
    This method deletes a given employee from the array.
    boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
    This method sets the hours that a parttime employee has worked during the pay period.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • emplist

      private Employee[] emplist

    • numEmployee

      private int numEmployee

    • CAPACITY

      private int CAPACITY

  • Constructor Details

    • Company

      public Company()
      The default constructor to make empty employee system.

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Employee employee)
      A helper method used within the public methods in this class to find the index of a requested employee.
      Parameters:
      employee - object is being searched for
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the index at which the employee is located

    • grow

      private void grow()
      A helper method we use in the add() method to grow the array everytime it reaches maximum capacity.

    • add

      public boolean add​(Employee employee)
      This method adds employees to our employee array. It calls both the grow() and find() helper methods.
      Parameters:
      employee - object being added
      Returns:
      true if the employee was added to the array, false otherwise

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Employee employee)
      This method deletes a given employee from the array. It calls the find() helper method to make it easier to find the index of the meployee that needs to be removed.
      Parameters:
      employee - object being removed
      Returns:
      true if the employee has been removed, false otherwise

    • setHours

      public boolean setHours​(Employee employee)
      This method sets the hours that a parttime employee has worked during the pay period. Necessary to call before the periods payments are calculated, otherwise some parttimers are going home with no money.
      Parameters:
      employee - object that is also of type parttime
      Returns:
      true if the employee's hours for this period has been set, false otherwise

    • processPayments

      public void processPayments()
      This method is to be called in the PayrollProcessing class when a user commands the program to give the employees their bi-weekly payments.

    • print

      public java.lang.String print()
      This method is invoked to print the current state of the employee list.
      Returns:
      string list of employees in the order they were added in

    • printByDepartment

      public java.lang.String printByDepartment()
      This method is invoked to print the employee list by department in alphabetical order.
      Returns:
      string list of employees in the order of their departments

    • printByDate

      public java.lang.String printByDate()
      This method is invoked to print the employee list by the dates each employee was hired in ascending order.
      Returns:
      string list of employees in chronological order of when they were hired

    • exportDatabase

      public java.lang.String exportDatabase​(java.io.File sourceFile)
      Helps export the current database.
      Parameters:
      sourceFile - is the file to be exported.
      Returns:
      string literal of the state of the source file.
